events.title: Donald Trump explores Reform Party presidential candidacy
events.description: Trump publicly flirts with a run for president under the Reform Party banner, appearing on talk shows. He withdraws by February 2000, criticizing party infighting.

moneyFlow.description: Trump's brief exploration of a Reform Party presidential candidacy in early 2000 involved campaign expenses, but the total amount spent was minimal as he withdrew by February 14, 2000, before establishing a formal campaign operation. This political venture was primarily a publicity effort rather than a significant financial investment.

events.title: Trump explores Reform Party candidacy
events.description: Trump briefly explores running for president as the Reform Party candidate. He forms an exploratory committee, releases a book ('The America We Deserve'), and campaigns in several states before withdrawing from the race on February 14, 2000.

moneyFlow.description: Trump's exploration of a Reform Party candidacy was primarily a publicity effort. While he spent minimal personal funds on the effort, the real value came from free media coverage that both promoted his book and overall brand.

events.title: TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED established in BVI
events.description: TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED was incorporated in the British Virgin Islands, with Serik Rakhmetov (likely of Kazakh origin) identified as a shareholder. The timing coincided with Trump's Reform Party presidential campaign and issues with the New York State Lobbying Commission.

moneyFlow.description: The creation of TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED in the British Virgin Islands represented an offshore financial structure with a connection to a Kazakh individual named Serik Rakhmetov. While the exact monetary value is unknown, this entity could potentially have been used to facilitate investments in Trump properties by Central Asian investors.

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer, future 45th President of the US. In 2000, made his first serious venture into politics by exploring a presidential run with the Reform Party, establishing himself as a political figure.

entity-102.name: TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED
entity-102.description: Offshore company incorporated in the British Virgin Islands on November 13, 2000. The company name appears to reference Trump, though with an extra 'P', and had a Central Asian shareholder named Serik Rakhmetov.
entity-102.notes: Discovered in the Panama Papers investigations.

entity-103.name: Serik Rakhmetov
entity-103.description: Individual of apparent Kazakh origin identified in the Panama Papers as a shareholder of TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED, an offshore company with a name similar to Trump.
entity-103.notes: Discovered in the Panama Papers investigations.

relationships.description: TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED, an offshore company with a name similar to Trump's, was established in the British Virgin Islands during Trump's Reform Party candidacy. While direct ownership by Trump is not confirmed, the name suggests a connection.
relationships.notes: The connection is implied by the company name but requires further investigation.

relationships.description: Serik Rakhmetov, an individual of apparent Kazakh origin, is identified in the Panama Papers as a shareholder of TRUMPP EQUITIES LIMITED.
relationships.notes: This relationship is directly confirmed by the Panama Papers data.
